ngiemboon: «Á ge láʼ gwɔ́ fʉʼó ŋwɛ́, atsɔ́ sáʼa ntse cwóŋ, é sɔgɔ mefʉa lâ ncÿǒ, á na ngẅɛ̀ fùɔ Ndavîd, mbɔɔ na patsẅé Yelúzálèm.»
en: “On that day a fountain   will be opened for the house of David and for the residents of Jerusalem, to wash away sin and impurity.  # 13:1 Zch 3:1–10

ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gẅie à piʼi kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ ne ńgɔɔn ngie: «Á ge láʼ gwɔ́ fʉʼó ŋwɛ́, m bú ḿbyág messé mie ée metútú tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ, tà mé le láʼ ńgíŋ ńkíme wɔ́b wɔ́. N ge láʼ pú fó tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ, é jwoŋ pantsẅìnkʉ̀ Ssé petepòŋ, é piŋ kẅile zẅìge gie á gÿo mé guʼte tsɔ́ messé.
en: On that day” #— #this is the declaration of the Lord of Armies #— #“I will remove the names of the idols from the land, and they will no longer be remembered.   I will banish the prophets  # 13:2 = false prophets and the unclean spirit from the land.

ngiemboon: Ńgwɔ́ gie nyìŋ lɔɔn ńgíŋ éfaʼa légÿo páʼ ntsẅìnkʉ̀ Ssé, mbà kwàʼ tá we pɔ́ má we ge gɔɔn né yé ngie: “Ɔ̀ ge kwé, á nue ɔ̀ tǎŋ melɔ̀ɔn na lezíŋ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a!” Ḿbiŋ ńgwɔ́ gie à ne ńtsẅii nkʉ̀, ngie éfóo mbwó mèŋ, té gwɔ́ gie áa púʼu, mbà tá we pɔ́ má we pie é la zyé yé zɔ ge zẅé yé.
en: If a man still prophesies, his father and his mother who bore him will say to him, ‘You cannot remain alive because you have spoken a lie in the name of the Lord.’ When he prophesies, his father and his mother who bore him will pierce him through.

ngiemboon: Á ge láʼ gwɔ́ fʉʼó ŋwɛ́, eshʉ́ kúu wɛ̌ wɛ̌ ntsẅìnkʉ̀ Ssé wɔ́ɔ, lélaʼte mmó gie e Ssé nyɛ̌ʼ nÿɔ́g mé, á gyá. Pɔ́ té gÿo gíŋe maʼ menzsǒ patsẅìnkʉ̀ Ssé mie mé lɔ̌g ngùb nɔ̀ɔn ńtém, é lɔg fʉte pʉ̀a wɔ́.
en: On that day every prophet will be ashamed of his vision when he prophesies; they will not put on a hairy cloak   in order to deceive.

ngiemboon: Awɔ̌ nyìŋ wɔ́ɔ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b ge gÿo gɔɔn ngie: “N te ntsẅìnkʉ̀ Ssé wɔ́, n gwɔ́ pɔ́ njʉ̀ʼngwóŋ, n gee ńjʉ́ʼʉ pɔ́ ngwóŋ, ńdɔgɔ ńjÿɔ́gɔ pʉ̀a mesoŋ, tà fó páʼ n da nyé ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ múɔshùm.”
en: He will say, ‘I am not a prophet; I work the land, for a man purchased   me as a servant since my youth.’  # 13:5 Am 7:14

ngiemboon: Táʼ, ńgwɔ́ gie mé lɔɔn ńzɛ́te yé ngie: “Mefʉ̌ŋ mɔɔn mie ée legù gù lɔɔn, é fóo na kɔ́?” Mbà à ge tsɔ́ʼ ngie: “N da gʉa mbʉ̀a meshǔ pɔ́ɔn tá mé néŋ!”»
en: If someone asks him, ‘What are these wounds   on your chest?’  # 13:6 Lit wounds between your hands  #— #then he will answer, ‘I received the wounds in the house of my friends.’

ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gẅie à piʼi kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ ne ńgɔɔn ngie:
Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gíŋ ńne ńgɔɔn ngie: «Mé ge gÿo gabte patsẅé tsɛ̀ɛ láʼ nzsè tá, nzsè pʉ́a kwéte, tàʼ nzsè ndàʼ zɔ tsẅɛ́.

N ge gÿo lɔg mmɔ̌g, é kẅile ncÿǒ na pfwɔ̀ʼɔ pʉ̀a pie é tsẅɛ́ɛ, ndʉŋndʉŋ páʼ mé lɔgɔ mmɔ̌g ńdɔ́ɔn tʉ̌ nkáb, ńkẅile ncÿǒ mǒ la. N ge gÿo cwoŋo tsaʼa wɔ́b páʼ mé tsaʼa tʉ̌ ngɔ̂ɔ la. À cʉa púʼu, pɔ́ leen ńké, ésẅíŋte wɔ́ɔn, n júʼu sẅíŋtè yɔ́b, ńgɔɔn ngie: “Pi ee pʉ̀a pɔ́ɔn.” Pɔ́ gɔɔn ngie: “Cʉ̀apʉ̀a ee Ssé yeg.”»
en: I will put this third through the fire;
